current.glossary_term_content_1: Standard theatrical size posters; typically 27x40 or 41”.
current.glossary_term_content_2: Oversize - consists of 4 smaller pieces that create 1 large poster.
current.glossary_term_content_3: Usually consists of  2 smaller pieces to make 1 large poster.
current.glossary_term_content_4: Released theatrically in the UK; Typically 40x30”.
current.glossary_term_content_5: Promotional posters used in store front windows.
current.glossary_term_content_6: Scenes from movie printed on  card stock - for display in theater lobby.
current.glossary_term_content_7: Color or Black and White photos from  movie- used in press packages.

current.glossary_term_content_9: Narrow vertical theater display; No longer in use.

current.glossary_term_content_13: Printed on one side, white on back.
current.glossary_term_content_14: Stored and shipped rolled up, usually near mint condition.
current.glossary_term_content_16: Printed on both sides, alternate image on back.
current.glossary_term_content_17: Printed by movie studio in limited quantity for theater display.

current.glossary_term_content_20: Issued months before the film's theatrical release,  usually with Coming soon and no credits.
current.glossary_term_content_21: Issued near the film's theatrical release  with credits at the bottom.
current.glossary_term_content_23: Differentiates between multiple posters  for the same subject or movie.
current.glossary_term_content_24: Printed for special occasion or in limited quantity.

current.glossary_term_content_26: Lobby cards or Stills sold as a set.

current.glossary_term_content_31: Photo quality sheen, sometimes UV protective finish.
current.glossary_term_content_32: Specialized printing/ink process results in superior quality, has the tonalities/hues of original print.
current.glossary_term_content_33: Paper has been dinged on the edge or in the  middle and small creases are shown.
current.glossary_term_content_34: Poster has creases/tears/tape/ripples usually  from being used in the past.
current.glossary_term_content_35: Displayed at movie theaters; very small holes  in the corners (made by push pins or staples).
current.glossary_term_content_37: Poster has visible flaws (usually tears or creases).
current.glossary_term_content_38: Poster is visibly damaged, needs repair.
current.glossary_term_content_39: Tape on back/front - usually to repair tears.
current.glossary_term_content_40: Still or card is glued onto the back  of another lobby card for a different film.
current.glossary_term_content_41: Audience warning stapled or glued to poster.  Usually can be steamed off with minimal damage.
current.glossary_term_content_42: Damage occurs from handling or storage,  edges becomes slightly crinkled or torn.
current.glossary_term_content_43: Has been previously owned or displayed in movie theaters.
current.glossary_term_content_44: Rating system (R, PG, G)is different, so a sticker  is placed over original countries rating.
current.glossary_term_content_46: Paper has been torn off and/or a surface  tear has the ink/paint removed.
current.glossary_term_content_47: Poster has been folded in the past and will have a crease line.
current.glossary_term_content_49: Dirt or other substances have touched  the paper leaving marks behind
current.glossary_term_content_50: Adhesive (sticker/tape/glue) has been removed from poster  leaving sticky/tacky substance or paper remnants behind.
current.glossary_term_content_51: The original title has been replaced with French title.  Can be done with sticker, pen or paint.

current.glossary_term_content_58: There is 1 crease/mark on the poster
current.glossary_term_content_59: There are tape marks/residue on the front and/or back of the poster from being displayed in theatres
current.glossary_term_content_60: There are tape marks/residue on the front and/or back of the poster from being displayed in theatres

current.glossary_term_content_62: There is a piece missing from the poster which should be visible on the image

current.glossary_term_content_64: Stapled or glued to poster, usually covering rating or text

current.glossary_term_content_84:
A rare and unique glimpse into the machinations of what visceral filmmaking takes. Writer and Director, Brandon Cronenberg and Director of Photography Karim Hussain share their insights and tales from the creation of Possessor. Read the final script, study a DP's marked up shot list, explore the film set and actors via Brett Hurd's photography.
Only 250 made!

settings.content:
How it works

The Back Lit Movie Poster frame is designed to illuminate a double sided movie poster using diffused LED back lights. The 1 inch thick aluminum frame is constructed to 29.5in wide by 42in long, with a seamless finish and a sturdy hinge mechanism for simple poster exchange. The LED lights are both lightweight and low-energy, making wall-hanging easy and upkeep inexpensive.

Light diffusing optical acrylic and another layer of protective acrylic hold the poster in place and provide optimal visual impact. The frame plugs into a standard North American electrical outlet.

How it works

During plak mounting, the poster is mounted on a sturdy, 3/8” thick superior quality engineered wood. The edges are finely beveled and finished in black. The wood and the poster image are sealed with
a UV-resistant matte (non-glare) laminate. Comes ready to hang with a centered keyhole slot.

A permanent change

[warning icon] During this mounting process, the poster is permanently changed.
Any permanent change to the poster significantly decreases the collector value of the poster.

How it works

The canvas has a 7/8" thick wooden art-quality frame, and the image wraps around the edges of the canvas. once the paper poster is transferred to a canvas, it is hand-mounted around a sturdy wooden frame with a protective varnish applied. the final product is scratch and fade resistant. The image takes on the texture of the canvas

A permanent change

[warning icon] During this mounting process, the poster is permanently changed. Any permanent change to the poster significantly decreases the collector value of the poster.

settings.headline: Wood – Traditional
settings.content: Made from high quality, solid wood and show natural visible grain.

settings.headline: Wood – Contemporary
settings.content: Sophisticated yet simple, with a wide range of colours.

settings.headline: Metal – Contemporary
settings.content: Strong and sleek, and in a wide range  of colors.

Shatterproof clear acrylic

All frames come standard with lightweight and shatterproof clear acrylic that protects the posters from dust and fingerprints.

Additionally, non-glare acrylic is available which minimizes reflections and glare, while still being lightweight and shatterproof.

Dry mounted-backing

[warning icon] During this mounting process, the poster is permanently changed.
Any permanent change to the poster significantly decreases the collector value of the poster.

Dry mounting is the bonding of the poster to a foam core using heat-activated adhesive. This prevents any stretching and wrinkling of the poster. It is highly recommended for reprint posters.

settings.right_column_callout: Own a piece of movie history.

settings.title: Original Posters
settings.content: From the studio to your wall, own a piece of movie history.

settings.title: One Sheet
settings.glossary_term_content: Standard theatrical size posters; typically 27x40 or 41”.

settings.title: Six Sheet
settings.glossary_term_content: Oversize - consists of 4 smaller pieces that create 1 large poster.

settings.title: Three Sheet
settings.glossary_term_content: Usually consists of  2 smaller pieces to make 1 large poster.

settings.title: British Quad
settings.glossary_term_content: Released theatrically in the UK; Typically 40x30”.

settings.title: Window Card
settings.glossary_term_content: Promotional posters used in store front windows.

settings.title: Lobby
settings.glossary_term_content: Scenes from movie printed on  card stock - for display in theater lobby.

settings.title: Still
settings.glossary_term_content: Color or Black and White photos from  movie- used in press packages.

settings.title: Half Sheet
settings.glossary_term_content: Horizontal theater display; No longer in use.

settings.title: Insert
settings.glossary_term_content: Narrow vertical theater display; No longer in use.

settings.title: Press Kit
settings.glossary_term_content: Press promotional information with stills.

settings.title: Press Book
settings.glossary_term_content: Promotional material released to media.

settings.title: Double Sided
settings.glossary_term_content: Printed on both sides, mirror image on back.

settings.title: Single Sided
settings.glossary_term_content: Printed on one side, white on back.

settings.title: Rolled
settings.glossary_term_content: Stored and shipped rolled up, usually near mint condition.

settings.title: Folded
settings.glossary_term_content: 3 horizontal and 1 vertical fold.

settings.title: Two Sided
settings.glossary_term_content: Printed on both sides, alternate image on back.

settings.title: Original
settings.glossary_term_content: Printed by movie studio in limited quantity for theater display.

settings.title: Reprint
settings.glossary_term_content: Copy of an original theatrical movie poster.

settings.title: Print
settings.glossary_term_content: After-market commercial poster.

settings.title: Advance
settings.glossary_term_content: Issued months before the film's theatrical release,  usually with Coming soon and no credits.

settings.title: Regular
settings.glossary_term_content: Issued near the film's theatrical release  with credits at the bottom.

settings.title: A-B-C
settings.glossary_term_content: Differentiates between multiple posters  for the same subject or movie.

settings.title: Limited Edition
settings.glossary_term_content: Printed for special occasion or in limited quantity.

settings.title: Special Edition
settings.glossary_term_content: Printed for special occasion IE anniversary etc.

settings.title: Set of #
settings.glossary_term_content: Lobby cards or Stills sold as a set.

settings.title: Reissued
settings.glossary_term_content: Item is re-issued again post original release.

settings.title: Rerelease
settings.glossary_term_content: Item is released again with return to cinemas.

settings.title: Linen-Backed
settings.glossary_term_content: Mounted onto linen fabric - perfect  for restoration and preservation.

settings.title: Satin Finish
settings.glossary_term_content: High paper and ink quality.

settings.title: Glossy
settings.glossary_term_content: Photo quality sheen, sometimes UV protective finish.

settings.title: Giclee
settings.glossary_term_content: Specialized printing/ink process results in superior quality, has the tonalities/hues of original print.

settings.title: Creases
settings.glossary_term_content: Paper has been dinged on the edge or in the  middle and small creases are shown.

settings.title: Damage
settings.glossary_term_content: Poster has creases/tears/tape/ripples usually  from being used in the past.

settings.title: Pin Holes
settings.glossary_term_content: Displayed at movie theaters; very small holes  in the corners (made by push pins or staples).

settings.title: Tears
settings.glossary_term_content: Paper has ripped.

settings.title: Fair Condition
settings.glossary_term_content: Poster has visible flaws (usually tears or creases).

settings.title: Poor Condition
settings.glossary_term_content: Poster is visibly damaged, needs repair.

settings.title: Tape Repair
settings.glossary_term_content: Tape on back/front - usually to repair tears.

settings.title: Glued to Lobby Cards
settings.glossary_term_content: Still or card is glued onto the back  of another lobby card for a different film.

settings.title: Censor Sticker
settings.glossary_term_content: Audience warning stapled or glued to poster.  Usually can be steamed off with minimal damage.

settings.title: Edge Wear
settings.glossary_term_content: Damage occurs from handling or storage,  edges becomes slightly crinkled or torn.

settings.title: Used
settings.glossary_term_content: Has been previously owned or displayed in movie theaters.

settings.title: Sticker Over Rating
settings.glossary_term_content: Rating system (R, PG, G)is different, so a sticker  is placed over original countries rating.

settings.title: Near Mint
settings.glossary_term_content: Almost perfect shape.

settings.title: Paper Loss
settings.glossary_term_content: Paper has been torn off and/or a surface  tear has the ink/paint removed.

settings.title: Fold Lines
settings.glossary_term_content: Poster has been folded in the past and will have a crease line.

settings.title: Print Flaw
settings.glossary_term_content: Ink has bled or smudged.

settings.title: Stains
settings.glossary_term_content: Dirt or other substances have touched  the paper leaving marks behind

settings.title: Residue
settings.glossary_term_content: Adhesive (sticker/tape/glue) has been removed from poster  leaving sticky/tacky substance or paper remnants behind.

settings.title: French Overprint
settings.glossary_term_content: The original title has been replaced with French title.  Can be done with sticker, pen or paint.

settings.title: Canadian Tour
settings.glossary_term_content: Canadian Tour

settings.title: North American Tour
settings.glossary_term_content: North American Tour

settings.title: American Tour
settings.glossary_term_content: American Tour

settings.title: International Tour
settings.glossary_term_content: International Tour

settings.title: Minor Creases
settings.glossary_term_content: Slight damage due to handling

settings.title: Edge Tears
settings.glossary_term_content: poster has some small tears along the outside edge

settings.title: Crease
settings.glossary_term_content: There is 1 crease/mark on the poster

settings.title: Tape
settings.glossary_term_content: There are tape marks/residue on the front and/or back of the poster from being displayed in theatres

settings.title: Tape Marks
settings.glossary_term_content: There are tape marks/residue on the front and/or back of the poster from being displayed in theatres

settings.title: Corner Missing
settings.glossary_term_content: There is a corner missing from the poster which is visible on the image

settings.title: Piece Missing
settings.glossary_term_content: There is a piece missing from the poster which should be visible on the image

settings.title: Stickers
settings.glossary_term_content: Audience warning stapled or glued to poster.  Usually can be steamed off with minimal damage

settings.title: Sticker
settings.glossary_term_content: Stapled or glued to poster, usually covering rating or text

settings.title: Rating Sticker
settings.glossary_term_content: Audience warning stapled or glued to poster.  Usually can be steamed off with minimal damage.

settings.title: Stain
settings.glossary_term_content: Dirt or other substance has touched  the paper leaving a mark behind

settings.title: Small Tears
settings.glossary_term_content: poster has some small tears along the outside edge

settings.title: Wrong Date
settings.glossary_term_content: The poster was recalled or Release date pushed so incorrect date is displayed

settings.title: Recalled
settings.glossary_term_content: The poster was recalled by the movie studio, could display incorrect release date etc.

settings.title: Ragged Edges
settings.glossary_term_content: Damage occurs from handling or storage,  edges becomes slightly crinkled or torn.

settings.title: Trimmed
settings.glossary_term_content: Poster has been trimmed slightly from the original size

settings.title: Folds
settings.glossary_term_content: Poster has been folded in the past and will have a crease line.

settings.title: Fold Lines
settings.glossary_term_content: Poster has been folded in the past and will have a crease line.

settings.title: Printer Burn
settings.glossary_term_content: there is a marking or two on the poster from a printing error by the movie studio

settings.title: Marks
settings.glossary_term_content: there are damage marks on the poster

settings.title: Writing on Back
settings.glossary_term_content: there is writing on the back of the poster from theatre use

settings.title: Photos Glued on Back
settings.glossary_term_content: Still or card is glued onto the back  of another lobby card for a different film.

settings.glossary_term_tag: Glued on back of Lobby Cards
settings.title: Glued on back of Lobby Cards
settings.glossary_term_content: Still or card is glued onto the back  of another lobby card for a different film.

settings.glossary_term_tag: Glued on back of lobby card
settings.title: Glued on back of lobby card
settings.glossary_term_content: Still or card is glued onto the back  of another lobby card for a different film.

settings.title: Glued on Back
settings.glossary_term_content: Still or card is glued onto the back  of another lobby card for a different film.

settings.title: 20th Anniversary
settings.glossary_term_content: Poster that was released 20 years after the original release date

settings.title: Pen Marks
settings.glossary_term_content: Ink from a pen or marker is shown

settings.title: Out of Print
settings.glossary_term_content: Poster has been discontinued from it's distributor.

settings.title: Collectors' Book
settings.glossary_term_content:
A rare and unique glimpse into the machinations of what visceral filmmaking takes. Writer and Director, Brandon Cronenberg and Director of Photography Karim Hussain share their insights and tales from the creation of Possessor. Read the final script, study a DP's marked up shot list, explore the film set and actors via Brett Hurd's photography.
Only 250 made!

settings.title: Canadian Blu Ray
settings.glossary_term_content:
Digital Copy of Possessor
  -Deleted Scenes
  -Behind the Scenes
A Brandon Cronenberg Short Film: Please Speak Continuously and Describe Your Experiences as They Come to You

settings.headline: Original Movie Posters
settings.content: Printed by a film studio in limited quantity, for display in movie theaters to promote the film. These posters can become highly valued, prized art and collector items.

settings.headline: Become a collector
settings.content: If you have a passion for a film, an actor, actress, director, or graphic arist. you can savor the passion by having the original movie poster on your wall. In some cases, a movie poster will strike such a chord among movie-goers that the original movie poster becomes highly valued by collectors.

settings.headline: A great investment
settings.content: Original movie posters can become highly valued, prized collector items.<br class="xlarge--hide large--hide">This can take years or sometimes days. Movies are universal, and the entire world loves classic movies like The Wizard of Oz, Gone with the Wind, Jaws, and many others will continue to grow in value. Qualities of a good investment include: great artwork, a notable star or director, and a movie you can watch over and over again.

settings.headline: State of the art
settings.content: Many movie posters have been designed by famous graphic artists and illustrators.

settings.headline: Framing & Storage
settings.content: We recommend using high grade plexi-glass and a frame to protect your poster. It’s best to hang your poster in a dry, cool environment not in direct sunlight. For storage, we recommend rolling your poster in an acid free tube and/or plastics sleeve.

settings.format_content:
Glossy photographs of film scenes
Usually in sets of 8

Posters printed on heavy stock
Same artwork as on the One Sheet

Posters printed on heavy stock
Same artwork as on the One Sheet

normal stock

Super-large posters printed on 
normal stock

settings.headline: Common Formats
settings.content: There have been many kinds of print materials used to promote the film in the theaters.
We ship all over the world.
Join our weekly email newsletter for all the latest and hottest new movie posters!
Poster will be shipped in the selected frame or mounted to a canvas or plak.
These frames are shipped separately,  and take 1 to 3 weeks to arrive.
You can return unframed/mounted  items within 10 days of receipt.

1-877-876-7837
support@movieposters.com

settings.dry_mounted_content: This prevents any stretching and wrinkling.

settings.social_content: We love seeing your framed posters in action! Share a photo  on social media and tag us to be featured in our Wall of Frame!

settings.headline: Custom Frames
settings.content: A unique and customized method to preserve and display your posters.

settings.headline: ReadyMade Frames
settings.content: The easy solution to framing your poster. These frames are shipped separately.

settings.headline: Backlit Frames
settings.content: Designed to illuminate 27in x 40in  double sided movie posters.

settings.headline: Plak Mounting
settings.content: A durable and modern poster mounting method without a frame.

settings.headline: Canvas Mounting
settings.content: A durable and elegant option to display your poster - perfect for home theaters.

settings.headline: Sleeves & Hangers

settings.headline: This is the beginning of a rewarding friendship.
